intro: Cyphostemma laza, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. Cyphostemma laza is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
